content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Well defined and ready to clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve this contribution because the wording of the exercise is well-written. I agree with EneaVictor's comment: I think it is ready for competition - the time you need to resolve this exercise is perfect for a game of clash of code.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: In my oppinion it is ready for competition.
I think you should specify the rounding rule, more exactly, specify if you rounded the decimals or if you just showed the first 2 digits.

Goal
* Please provide all relevant formulas as this is not a test on accounting or business knowledge.

Input
* Line 2 and Line 3: Please change "A number" to "A float".

Output
* Line 1 and Line 2: Please mention that the answer should be preceded with {{$}} ({{ }} is the syntax for formatting text as a constant).

* Please delete "leading" (3 times).

* Suggest to add "all results" after "Round" to avoid the misunderstanding that rounding applies to Line 3 only.

Constraints
* Please add that gross profit is always positive. (It can be zero or negative, but that scenario is not tested in any of the existing cases. To cover the case of zero profit or gross loss would require additional explanation on the output format.)

Stub generator
* Line 2 and Line 3" Please change "string(11)" to "float".

Cases
* Validator 2: Please revise [[P]] to be a float, similar to Test 2.

* Validator 3: Please revise [[P]] and [[C]] to be floats, and the magnitudes of all the input values to be more similar to Test 3.

* Test 4: Please revise the value of [[C]] as it violates the constraint.

* Validator 4: Please revise [[P]] and [[C]] to be floats, and the magnitudes of all the input values *AND* output values to be more similar to Test 4. (In particular, the gross profit margin should be less than 10%.)

Thanks.
Thanks for the corrections, all fixed
